src/lib/components/DashDockLayout.react..description:
DashDockLayout is a component that provides a flexible docking system for Dash applications,
allowing users to create, resize, and rearrange panels in a window manager style interface.
Supports floating groups, layout persistence, and renders Dash components inside panels.

Panel positioning options:
- position: 'left' | 'right' | 'top' | 'bottom' | 'center' (default: 'center')
- size: number (pixels for positioned panels)
- visible: boolean (default: true)
- active: boolean (set as initially active panel)

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

children.description: Dash components to render in panels. Each child should have an id matching a panel id.

panels.description:
Initial panels to display. Each panel can have positioning options.
- id: (required) Unique panel identifier
- title: Display title for the tab
- position: 'left' | 'right' | 'top' | 'bottom' | 'center' (default: 'center')
- size: Initial size in pixels for positioned panels
- visible: Whether panel is visible on load (default: true)
- active: Whether this panel should be active/focused on load
- collapsed: Whether panel group starts collapsed (shows only tab header)

activePanel.description: Currently active panel ID (read-only, updated by component)

layout.description: Current layout configuration (read-only, updated by component)

savedLayout.description: Layout JSON to load. Set this to restore a previously saved layout.

initialLayout.description:
Initial layout configuration. Use this to define complex layouts.
This is a Dockview JSON layout object with grid, panels, and activeGroup.
Use the `layout` output prop to capture a layout and reuse it here.

locked.description: Lock the entire layout (prevents all modifications)

hideCloseButtons.description: Hide close buttons on all tabs. When true, users cannot close panels.

panelAdded.description: Last added panel info (read-only, updated by component)

panelRemoved.description: Last removed panel info (read-only, updated by component)

panelCount.description: Total number of panels (read-only, updated by component)

loadLayoutTrigger.description:
Trigger to load a layout. Set to {layout, timestamp} to load a saved layout.
The timestamp ensures React sees each load as a new value.

addPanelTrigger.description:
Trigger to add a panel. Set to {id, title} to add a new panel.
Supports position for placing relative to existing panels:
- position: {referencePanel: 'panel-id', direction: 'below'|'above'|'left'|'right'|'within'}
- size: Initial size in pixels (height for above/below, width for left/right)

removePanelTrigger.description: Panel ID to remove. Set this to remove a panel.

clearTrigger.description: Set to true to clear all panels

activatePanelTrigger.description:
Trigger to activate/switch to a specific panel tab.
Set to {panelId: string, timestamp?: number} to activate that panel.
The timestamp ensures React sees repeated activations as new values.

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called to report property changes
to Dash, to make them available for callbacks.

src/lib/components/DashGridLayout.react..description:
DashGridLayout is a component that provides a grid-based resizable panel system.
Panels can be arranged in rows and columns with adjustable proportions.

src/lib/components/DashPaneLayout.react..description:
DashPaneLayout is a component that provides collapsible panes (accordion style).
Each pane has a header that can be clicked to expand/collapse the content.

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

children.description: Dash components to render in panels. Each child should have an id matching a panel id.

src/lib/components/DashSplitLayout.react.description:
DashSplitLayout is a component that provides a simple split panel system.
Panels are arranged either horizontally or vertically with resizable dividers.
